column4: For some reason, only one sound application is allowed access to my audio i/o layer.
At a time to qualify it.
I get the problem with all apps.
Can I disable audio I/O locking?
I just joined, but it sounds like your audio software is using OSS and not ALSA, which means only one can be used at a time.
Can I force them to use ALSA?
what programs are they?
Flash, Audacity, YSFlight simulator, most games
there's a program you can install that will put an OSS emulation wrapper around those programs to have them use ALSA.
sudo aptitude install alsa-oss
must it be configured for every single application or will it automatically wrap them all?
you'll have to change the menu entries for those programs to have them run through it
So it's probably not a sound card issue?
you just need to run the app as "aoss <appname>". You can do that to test it, then change your menu entries to do that.
definitely not a soundcard issue
What about embedded applications like flash and java?
those are stealing sound too? Are you using Flash 7?
I don't have Java installed but when I am running flash, I can't run Audacity; I was just assuming Java since everything else does but flash 100% sure
I need to check the version though; one moment
Adobe Flash player 9 but anything I have run that plays sound except Gaim hogs my sound i/o layer.

there's a way to get Firefox to use aoss for its sound. But hold on, Ubotu has a factoid about sound, and you may want to read that to see if anything solves your problems. Some apps will still need to use AOSS however.
